trends: There have been 2 other sightings in Oviedo
There were no other sightings in Oviedo on or around February 1st 2005
divs: Sighting DetailsSighting Report: In Orlando Florida on February 1st 2005 at 8:20am local time, I saw an object about the size of a basketball in the sky. At first I thought it was a baloon, but there was very little wind and the object was moving towards the wind. This made me curious, and I began to look more closely at it. I quickly realized it was not a baloon and may have quite possibly been what WWII Air Force Pilots called a "Foo Fighter". As I said; the object was about the size of a basketball, dark grey in color, was not perfectly spherical, but spherical with a smaller protruding lobe visible on the one side that I was looking at. The objects altitude was approximately 150 to 200 feet, and was traveling from the Northeast to the Southwest at 30 to 35 mph. I observed the object for 60 to 90 seconds as it flew in a perfectly straight and level flight path untill I could no longer see it. The object had no lights of any kind, and made no sound. I was on the corner of Semeron Blvd. (S.R. 436) and Michigan Street. This area is just a couple of miles from Orlando International Airport. This intersection is actually on OIA s glide path, and the object was headed towards the airport.The weather was good; 55 degrees fahrenheit, very light cirrus clouds, and a light variable breeze.
